result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven R. Scholze was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any probation now serving

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  No DNA surcharge assessed.
Must maintain full-time employment which is satisfactory to your probation agent.  You must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an AODA assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants.  Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    You shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with any of the following individuals:  Lucas Shankey or Brenda Flood.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Must comply with any other programming recommendations of agent which may include anger management.  If there are no new charges or convictions after 30 months defendant may apply for early release from remaining probation term if compliant with all conditions as ordered.  Must submit a DNA sample if not already on file.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution ordered at zero.
to modify JOC
from Judge Goodman to AIA Inlow and Attorney Ritland.
from DOC.  Faxed to Judge Goodman.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears with counsel James Ritland.  ADA Inlow appears for the State.  Inlow states the defendant will plead today.  Judge reviewed the charges/penalties of charges he will plead to today.  DA has complied with victim notification as required by law.  Court notifies defendant of felony conviction warning.  Defendant pleads no contest to all the following cases/charges:  14CF48 - Count 1; 14CF228 - Counts 1 & 3; 14CF88 -  Count 1.  Judge reviews elements of charges he's pleading to today.  Defense stipulates to facts in the complaint and agrees there is a factual basis for his pleas.  State recommends 3 years probation with conditions as stated in agreement:  restitution; no contact with L.S. or B.F.; maintain employment, must undergo a risk and needs assessment and must comply with any conditions recommended which may include anger mangagmen;  no drugs or paraphernalia; AODA assessment and must follow all recommendations;  no alcohol consumption or be where available.  Defense doesn't agree with restitution in 14CF228 and requests a restitution hearing.  State will schedule the restitution hearing.   Court reviews PLQ and elements of each charge plead to and makes a finding that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his rights, makes his pleas, a factual basis exists for each plea.  Court accepts the pleas and finds him guilty of charges plead to.  Defense agrees to terms of probation but requests a 2 1/2 years probation term rather than 3 years.  Defendant does not speak on his behalf.  Court orders 3 years probation concurrent with probation now serving but after 30 months he may apply for early discharge if no new charges/convictions.  All conditions ordered as recited by ADA Inlow.  Inlow is unsure what he has for jail credit.  She will get an accurate accounting of jail credit from the jail.  Court instructs counsel to prepare a stipulation if they agree and send with a proposed order to amend the JOC.  Costs assessed and no DNA surcharges assessed.  Must submit a DNA sample - he already has one on file.  15CF22 - DRI;  14CF162 - DRI; 14CF228 - Counts 2, 4, 5 ,6 are DRI; 14CF48 - Count 2 - DRI; 14FO546 - DRI.  Restitution order to be submitted within 60 days.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody.  Attorney Ritland appeared.  Defendant is not ready to plead today.  Reschedule to 12/22/15 at 1:15 pm.  Deadline to plead or settle.
Donna Deloske called wondered when she was going to get her bond money back; explained bond is still in effect case is still open

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Court advised the defendant of the charges.  Reading of the information waived.  Defendant stood mute to charge.  Court entered NGP.
Probable cause found.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ritland.  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties.  Court questioned whether defendant could proceed.  10 min break.  Court resumed at 3:46.  Attorney Ritland advised the court they are ready to proceed.  Court confirmed with the defendant that he is ready to proceed.  DA Fox satisified that the defendant can proceed.  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties again.  Defendant stated he understood.  Court reviewed the waiver form with the defendant.  He stated he understood.  Court found defendant freely, knowingly and intelligently waived his right to preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing at 05-14-2015 03:30 pm

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Ritland.  This case is still going to trial.  Open citations to track.  Court advised parties to file their proposed jury instructions 3 weeks prior to trial.  Paties state they have no pre-trial motions to be heard.
State's
State's
Jury trial - 12 person at 05-28-2015 09:00 am
Final pre-trial at 03-16-2015 03:00 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-27-2015 02:30 pm
DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Attorney Ritland appeared.  Parties have an agreement.  Set for plea/sentencing.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Brenda F nor any family members including Lucas S - not to go on any of her property.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
